She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances and the dry season which affects the supply of vegetables. She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenya shillings) loan to add a stock of vegetables for resale. Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future she will excel in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to add stock of drinks, cereals, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 34-year-old hardworking man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a retail shop  but also works as an electrician  in order to raise money to support his family.

Like most traders he is challenged by price fluctuation and inadequate capital, while his dream is to trade in wholesale. Charles intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar, cooking oil, washing detergents, and bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar, cooking oil, washing detergents, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a hard-working man with sx children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He operates a retail shop and also grows tea in order to support his family.  Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations are his major challenges, while his dream is to own a wholesale shop.

Nelson is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise, such as cooking oil, washing detergents, and sugar, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as cooking oil, washing detergents, and sugar, to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is requesting a loan to buy beer, soda, and local brew to sell.

He is 31 years and married, with two children, living in Hoima, Uganda. 

Price fluctuations and the high cost of rent are his major challenges, while his dreams are to own a wholesale shop and to buy a car to ease his movements.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, and local brew to sell.

loans.name: Bakr

texts.en:
Bakr is a young man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. Three years ago, Bakr opened a small drinking water purification station with the help of his late father. Bakr works very hard and does his best to provide his mother and little brothers and sisters with everything they need. He would like to expand his business. Therefore, he asked for a loan to buy construction supplies for his station in order to expand his business and to increase his profits. 

Bakr benefited from his first loan and hopes that his small drinking water purification station will make more profits and, in turn, help him to improve his family’s standard of living. He thanks Kiva lenders for financing his first loan.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for his drinking water purification station.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 51-year-old married man with 8 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He grows tea and operates a retail shop in order to boost his income. Inadequate capital and unpredictable weather changes affect his business. His vision is to educate his children and expand his farming activities. Christopher intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single woman. She has 2 children, ages 13 and 16 years. She describes herself to be calm. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes and cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a market area, and her primary customers are retailers.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to boost her business. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more tomatoes and cabbages to resale. She hopes that in the future, she will build her family home. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and save the rest.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes and cabbages to resale.

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace is a 31-year-old married woman with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells second-hand clothes, and with the income, she has been able to venture into motorcycle transport and build rental houses where she gets extra income. 

Limited capital and price fluctuations are her major challenges, while her vision is to buy more land and expand her transport business. Beatrace intends to buy a new motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be neat. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, water, salt and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a residential area, and her primary customers are retailers.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to boost business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, water and other items. 

Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and get more customers. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and save the rest.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, salt, water, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Khosrov

texts.en: Khosrov is an experienced farmer from Aygevan Village in the Armavir Region. He lives with his wife, two school age daughters (10 and 8 years old), and his parents. To meet the needs of his family, Khosrov breeds cattle and is engaged in the cultivation of alfalfa, peaches, and apricots. Khosrov has an established agribusiness, cultivating peaches and apricots in particular. He sells the agricultural products in the local market. As life is getting more expensive day by day, Khosrov wants to enlarge his agribusiness to cover the costs of his family more effectively. He needs a loan of 1500 USD to purchase a cow and to make previous credit repayments. Khosrov and his family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and they will be very grateful to lenders for helping them to collect the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to make previous credit repayments.

loans.name: Srbuhi

texts.en:
Srbuhi is a farmer from Taronik village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, son, and school-age daughter (17 years old). Her husband works in the music school and her son works in the private sector. 

Srbuhi works in the village's local self-governance body. The family works really hard to be able to earn a living. The family is also engaged in plant cultivation; they have a greenhouse, where they cultivate tomato, cucumber, and pepper. Srbuhi is also engaged in cultivation of watermelon. She currently needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to function in a sustainable way.

A loan of USD 2,500 will be a big support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling them to purchase bottles and cellophane for the greenhouse, buy cucumber seeds and some fertilizers, and renovate the greenhouse. 

She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Srbuhi was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history, and have no access to credit products. Srbuhi and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase bottles and cellophane for the greenhouse, buy cucumber seeds and some fertilizers, and renovate the greenhouse.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Ventanilla Alta Group

texts.es: Graciela tiene 39 años es separada con 3 hijos. Ella es integrante del grupo “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE VENTANILLA ALTA”  el grupo está conformado por 06 socias trabajadoras. Graciela  hace 03 años se dedica a la venta de anticuchos y bebidas, empezó este negocio por la necesidad de apoyar a sus hijos y se siente feliz porque ha logrado su cometido, su negocio es muy visitado por su clientela sobretodo trabajadores de la zona, su negocio está ubicado en su misma casa así puede estar junto a sus hijos que aun son pequeños. El préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en su negocio básicamente en la compra de insumos y la compra de bebidas, en adelante le gustaría abrir un restaurante para eso quiere aumentar su capital y acondicionar un local en su casa. Graciela y su grupo agradecen  a los inversionistas KIVA por este préstamo, en la foto es la primera de la izquierda viste pantalón color turqueza.
texts.en:
Graciela, 39, is separated and has three children. She belongs to the communal bank “Las Triunfadores de Ventanilla Alta,”  which comprises six working partners. For three years, Graciela has been selling meat skewers and beverages. She started the business to support her children and is happy to have met that goal. She has a lot of customers, especially local workers. The business is in her house, which means she can be with her young children.

She has applied for a loan to buy supplies and beverages for her business. Someday she would like to open a restaurant, so she wants to increase her capital and air condition a space in her house. Graciela and her group thank Kiva lenders for this loan. Graciela is the first woman on the left in the photo and is wearing turquoise pants.

loans.use: to buy supplies and beverages.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is married and has one child. She describes herself to be self-motivated. 

She operates a dairy farm where she keeps cows that produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area good for dairy farming, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed. Her business goal is to own about 20 dairy cows within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will improve living standards and excel in business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy animal feed for her dairy cows

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 31 years old and married, with two children. She describes herself to be aggressive. 

She operates a food stall where she sells fried potatoes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area fit for her business, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a stock of potatoes. Her business goal is to be stable within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan and expand business.

loans.use: buy a stock of potatoes

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a private entrepreneur from Gyumri city of Shirak region. He lives with his wife and two little children (five-year-old son and one-year-old daughter).  Armen earns a living for his family through running a local business of cold drinks production and delivery service of frozen chicken, household goods and toys. Armen is the only breadwinner of the family, and works very hard to be able to meet the everyday needs of his family. 

To be able to continue his business, Armen needs to make some investments. He particularly needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase several types of syrups, plastic bottles, stopples, and labels for the production of drinks. The loan will help him greatly to sustain his business. Armen and his family will be very grateful to all the lenders for their goodwill and support in collecting the needed amount of money.

loans.use: to purchase several types of syrups, plastic bottles, stopples and labels for the production of drinks.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark is a 34-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as innovative. He operates a gas store where he sells cooking gas. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to add to his stock of cooking gas for sale. His business goal is to own a big gas shop within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to his stock of cooking gas for sale.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is from Voskehask Village in the Shirak Region. She lives with her husband, son, and elderly mother. She works in a hospital as a nurse, and her husband works in the private sector. Their salaries, however, are not enough to fully meet their needs. 

Laura is engaged in breeding cows and piglets, and in beekeeping. Laura's husband and son help her greatly in everyday activities concerning beekeeping and livestock breeding. To sustain their agribusiness, the family needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase some feed for the livestock, wheat seeds to cultivate wheat, fuel for agricultural machinery, as well as to partially renovate the agricultural machinery. 

Laura has previously taken a loan from a local financial institution, but, unfortunately, wasn't able to pay it back. Thanks to her hard work during recent times, however, Laura was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. Thus, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Laura and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase some feed for the livestock, wheat seeds to cultivate wheat, fuel for agricultural machinery, as well as to partially renovate the agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Ervand

texts.en:
Ervand is from the Lernantsq village of Lori region. He lives with his wife, three children (daughter – 11 years old, two sons – 12 and 5 years old), and his mother. 

He is a construction worker, and he works hard to earn a living for the family. As the salary of a construction worker is not enough to address the needs of his family, Ervand is also engaged in beekeeping and in the cultivation of wheat, barley, potatos, and garlic. He sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

Ervand currently wants to start cattle breeding to cover the growing needs of his family more effectively. For this reason he needs a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a cow. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to his hard work during recent times, Ervand was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Ervand and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to start cattle-breeding

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl vive en la comunidad de Huayllabamba en el distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento  del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de construcción de casas, colegios y carreteras. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como herramientas y cemento, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. El cliente pertenece al banco comunal “Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba” y es una persona amable y carismática.
texts.en: Raúl lives in the community of Huayllabamba, in the district of Huancarani, in the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, Peru. His main economic activity is construction of houses, schools, and roads. At this time he needs the loan to buy work materials such as tools and cement. He is grateful for and values the loan and pledges to comply with the monthly repayments very responsibly. He belongs to the “Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba” communal bank and is a friendly and charismatic person.

loans.use: to buy work materials such as tools and cement.

loans.name: Martina Fatima

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Martina, tiene 55 años de edad, hace varios su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aun viven con ella. Es modista desde muy joven, estudio corte y confección en una Academia de esta ciudad. 
Doña Martina es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante con el fruto de sus trabajo, ella tiene un taller en el centro de la ciudad  lugar en el cual confecciona todo tipo de ropa, lo que más le gusta es  hacer vestidos de fiestas de niñas, ella también elabora prendas de dormir las misma que confecciona y vende en su local donde tiene unas vitrinas en las cuales enseña sus prendas para que los clientes las adquieran a precios razonables, trabaja todos los días casi todo el día.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas y otros materiales que se requieren para la costura. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos para salir adelante. 
Sus sueños son que nunca le falte trabajo y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Siempre Unidas" meets every two weeks in Jipijapa canton, which is named after a coffee sultan and is known for its extensive coffee farms that produce incomparably delicious coffee, for its food, and for its friendly residents. Martina, 55, lives here. Her husband died some years ago, and she has three grown children from the marriage, two of whom still live with her. 

She studied tailoring and dressmaking at a school in the city and has been a dressmaker from an early age. Martina works very hard, as she likes being able to take care of herself with the income from her job. She has a workshop in the city center, where she makes all kinds of clothing. She particularly likes making children's party dresses. She also makes pajamas to sell in her space, which has cases to display her affordable garments to customers. She works every day for most of the day. 

She will use this loan to to buy fabric and other tailoring materials. This is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank, which she likes because it allows her access to loans to keep going. She hopes that she will always have work and good health.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Margrett

texts.en: Margrett is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is tea farming alongside other farming to boost her income. She is facing challenges with unpredictable weather changes. Nevertheless, she has a vision of working extra hard to boost her income. Margrett has asked for a loan to buy manure for the tea plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure for the tea plantation.

loans.name: Damas Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: El Sr. Favio  tiene 57 años es viudo y tiene 04 hijos mayores de edad. El Sr Favio es integrante del grupo “DAMAS TRIUN FADORAS” es el único varón del grupo y este es su tercer desembolso,  se siente feliz porque ser parte del grupo es una gran ayuda para mejorar su negocio. Son 5 años que se dedica a la gastronomía tiene un restaurante donde su especialidad son los pescados y mariscos, su clientela es asidua porque siempre se esmera por brindarles una buena atención. El préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de productos pesqueros y demás insumos, en el futuro desea comprar un local propio para no tener que pagar alquiler y mejorar sus ingresos. El Sr.Favio y su grupo agradecen a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado.
texts.en: Favio is 57 year old. He is a widower and has 4 children who are all of age. Favio is a member of the group “Damas Triunfadoras.” He is the only man in the group and this is his third loan cycle. He is happy because being part of the group is a great help to his business. He has been working in the restaurant business for the past 5 years. He has a restaurant where his specialties are fish and sea food. He has regular customers because he always takes great pains to provide them with good service. The loan he  requested is for buying sea food products and other ingredients. In the future he wants to buy his own location so he won’t have to pay rent and so he can improve his income. Favio and his group are grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that has been granted.

loans.use: to buy seafood products.

loans.name: Diana Elena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de  25, 20, 11 y 2  años de edad,  las menores viven con ella y una estudia en escuela. Su esposo es chofer tiene un taxi.
Doña Diana para ayudarle a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar y para sentirse independiente desde hace 12 años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño comedor  en el terminal terrestre de su ciudad, allí ella  con la ayuda de su hermana a quien le paga un sueldo mensual por su trabajo  preparan deliciosos platos  que son el deleite de sus clientes, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las tres de la tarde. Ya que prepara desayunos y almuerzos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  12 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.  
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Siempre Unidas" meets every two weeks in Jipijapa canton, which is named for a coffee sultan and is known for its extensive coffee farms that produce a delicious coffee, for its food, and for its friendly residents. Diana, 42, lives here. She is married and has four children, ages 25, 20, 11, and 2, from the marriage. The youngest live with her and are students. Her husband drives a taxi. 

Twelve years ago, Diana started a business, a small diner located in a city terminal, so that she could help her husband meet household expenses and to feel independent. She pays her sister a monthly salary to help her, and they prepare delicious dishes that their customers love. Diana works Monday to Saturday from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. making breakfast and lunch.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other supplies to prepare the food. She has been a member of the communal bank for 12 years and likes the help she receives through the loans. Her goal is to keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es: El grupo “SIN FRONTERAS” está  conformado por 06 socias todas son trabajadoras dedicadas a sus negocios. Isabel es una de las socias  tiene 56 años y  es soltera. Ella es comerciante se dedica  la venta de abarrotes trabaja aproximadamente 07 horas diarias en un mercado de su zona, son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y uno de sus mayores logros es haber comprado su propio puesto, gracias a su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia con la economía. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de de arroz, azúcar, aceites  y toda clase de productos de abarrotes. Isabel y todo su grupo están agradecidos  a los inversionistas KIVA por el este préstamo. Isabel es la cuarta del lado izquierdo viste chompa color guinda,la Sra que esta sentada es madre de una de las socias
texts.en:
The Sin Fronteras group is comprised of six members.  All of them are hard-workers who are devoted to their businesses.  Isabel is one of the members.  She is 56 years old and single.  She sells groceries, and she works approximately seven hours a day at a market in her area.  She has had this business for 12 years.  One of her biggest achievements is having bought her own stand.  Thanks to her work she has been able to help her family with their finances.  

She will use the requested loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, and all types of grocery products.  Isabel and all of her group are grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan.  Isabel is the fourth from the left wearing a cherry colored sweater.  The woman who is seated is the mother of one of the members.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 51-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells washing soap, bread, sugar, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are people of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Elizabeth will use this KES 20,000 loan to add stocks of washing soap, sugar, sweets and other items to her store. She hopes that in the future she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy used the previous loan to buy exotic pigs to rear.She is a 39-year-old hardworking married woman with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a piggery business that has been very lucrative since the rate of multiplication is high. One pig can give birth to 24 piglets in a year. The high cost of feed and inadequate capital are her major challenges, and her dreams are educating her children and venturing into modern methods of farming. Teddy intends to use the loan to buy more exotic pigs to rear.

loans.use: buy pigs to rear

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer is a forty-year-old widow with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. For ten years she has been selling shoes and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Like most traders in the business she is challenged by inadequate capital and price fluctuation while her dream is to own a modern boutique. Jeniffer intends to use the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is an experienced agronomist from Lernantsq village in the Lori region. He lives with his wife (in the photo) and son. He works in the village's local self-governance body. His salary, however, is very low and is not enough to meet his family's needs. 

Gevorg takes care of his family's needs through breeding a livestock of cows, pigs, hens, and turkeys. He is also engaged in cultivation of wheat, barley, potato and alfalfa. Farming is the most important source of income for the family. Gevorg's wife and son assist him greatly in farming activities. They sell  their agricultural products in the local market. 

To run the agribusiness in a sustainable way, Gevorg needs to make some investments. He particularly needs a loan o USD 2300 to renovate agricultural machinery, to buy fuel for agricultural machinery and to make previous credit repayments. He and his family will be very thankful to the lenders for helping them collect the needed amount of loan to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: maintain his farm machinery

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is a farmer from Eghegnadzor city in the Vayots Dzor region. He lives with his wife and three school-age children (two daughters – 16 and 14 years old and one son – 5 years old). 

To take care of his family Garik works in the private sector.  However, the salary that he gets is so low that he cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. To be able to meet the needs of his family, Garik is engaged in breeding livestock (calves, pigs and hens) and in cultivating of fruits (peaches, apricots, apples, pears and walnut). 

Farming is a very important source of income for Garik's family. He currently needs to enlarge his agribusiness a little bit to be able to address the increasing needs of his family. A loan of USD 3000 will be a huge support to this hard-working man, enabling him to purchase a pig, two calves and forage for the livestock. The family is very thankful to all the lenders for helping them collect the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: buy livestock and forage to feed them

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik lives in Gugarq village with his wife and son. Yurik is a taxi driver with 5 years’ experience. He works day and night to gather enough income to sustain his family's living.  Yurik's wife works at a local music school and helps her husband with family's costs. 

Unfortunately, because of financial hardships that Yurik currently faces, he isn't able to renovate his car and continue his taxi driving business. Therefore, he is asking this loan to pay for the renovation of the vehicle and purchase of gasoline.  

Yurik has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan is very important for Yurik and his family, and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: repair his taxi

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat has been providing vehicle repair service for 30 years in Vanadzor town. He lives with his wife, who works at a local school as a teacher. 

Ararat is very hard working person and over years of tireless work, he has gained recognition among the locals. Now, Ararat has applied for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for his work. The current ones are in defective condition so it is very difficult for him to provide good quality work. 

Ararat has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This loan is highly important for Ararat to be able to continue his business and sustain his and his wife's living.

loans.use: buy vehicle repair tools

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik is from Gyumri town where he lives with his wife and 21-years-old son. A sportsman by profession, Rubik has been teaching at a local sports school for many years. As his teacher's salary is low and hardly enough for covering his family's basic needs, Rubik is also involved in a taxi driving business. 

Due to his hard work, Rubik is able to sustain his family's living. Unfortunately, his car currently is not in working condition and needs to be repaired. Because of the financial hardships that Rubik is facing, he is not able to pay for the car's repair and that's the reason he is asking for this loan. 

Rubik has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is highly important for Rubik and he hopes for lenders' good will and support.

loans.use: repair his taxi

loans.name: Mushegh

texts.en:
Mushegh is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his parents. Mushegh is an enthusiastic young man who has been providing renovation services to the locals for already 8 years. Due to being hard-working and for his high quality work, Mushegh is in much demand and is receiving a lot of orders.  

To be able to meet clients' current needs, Mushegh needs to purchase tools and materials for his work. Because of family's costs he isn't able to save money, so he has applied for this loan. 

Mushegh has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Mushegh and he hopes for lenders' support and good will.

loans.use: buy tools for his renovation business

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is from Kapan town where he lives with his wife and two little children. Samvel provides construction service to the locals of Kapan town. As the only breadwinner of the family, Samvel works hard to gather enough income and cover the family's costs. 

Samvel is asking for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials for his business. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Samvel and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: buy construction tools and materials

loans.name: Gharib

texts.en:
Gharib has been involved in his shoe repair business for already 8 years. He lives with his wife and son and is a very hardworking person. Currently, Gharib has many orders, but unfortunately because of shortage of tools and materials he isn't able to complete them. 

Gharib is asking for this loan to be able to purchase needed tools and materials to provide shoe repair service. He  has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is highly important for Gharib and he hopes for lenders' trust and support.

loans.use: buy shoe repair tools and materials

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: Porfirio, tiene 68 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos y reside en el municipio de el Negrito, Yoro, junto a su esposa y dos nietos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura principalmente al cultivo de maíz. La producción es vendida en la misma zona en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 6,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizantes para darle asistencia al cultivo de maíz. Su objetivo es mejorar la producción y obtener mejores ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar.
texts.en:
Porfirio, is 68-years-old and is in a common-law marriage with his wife. He has 5 children and lives in the town of El Negrito, Yoro with his wife and two grandchildren.

All of his life, he has been working in agriculture mainly growing corn. The produce is sold in the same area in the local market. He has requested a loan of 6,000 lempiras to buy manure and fertilizers so that he can produce corn. His aim is to improve production and gain a better income to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizer for growing corn.

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en: Marelyn is 52-years-old. She is married and has 2 adult children. She lives in Langub, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Marelyn has engaged in the sari-sari store business for 23 years earning a monthly income of 3000.  She also has a parcel of rice farm as another source of quarterly income and for their daily food consumption. Marelyn requested a new loan to purchase various materials for house renovation such as cement, sand, gravel, etc. Marelyn is a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since the year 2000. She dreams of having enough savings for future use.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials for house renovation

loans.name: Alexandra Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  23 y 17  años de edad,  ambos viven con ella y el menor  estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Alexandra con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de zapatos, bisutería y varios productos más, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en la terminal terrestres de esta ciudad lugar en el cual trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, allí también ella realiza recargas telefónicas con lo cual se gana algo extra y que le sirve para ayudarle a su hijo con sus estudios, este local tiene más de tres años pero antes ella vendía ropa en forma ambulante hasta que decidió instalar este negocio en este lugar, para esto se ayudo con los créditos que recibió del banco.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar zapatos, bisutería y para pagar las recargas telefónicas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 11 años  y le gusta por los créditos ya que son de gran ayuda en su negocio. 
Su sueño es ver que su hijo terminen sus estudios y sea un  buen profesional.
texts.en:
The Siempre Unidas communal bank meets every fifteen days in the Jipijapa Canton, known by the name of the sultana of coffee because of its large coffee crops. The taste is incomparable and the area is known for its food and the quality of its people.

Alexandra, 42, lives here. She is married with two children ages 23 and 17. They both live with her and the younger one is in school. Her husband is a vendor.

Alexandra makes a living selling shoes, jewelry, and other products so she can earn her own income. She has a small stand at the city's land terminal, where she works every day from 8am until 8pm. She also sells phone recharge cards, which helps her earn extra money to help her son with school. She has been at this location for over three years but before, she sold clothing door to door until she decided to start this business here. The loans she received from the bank helped her.

She will use this loan to buy shoes, jewelry, and phone recharge cards. She has been part of the communal bank for 11 years and she likes the loans because they are a big help to her business.

Her dream is to see her son finish school and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy shoes, jewelry, and phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Grisell Angie

texts.es: Grisell tiene 18  años de edad, es soltera y actualmente es estudiante de Cosmetología Dermatológica  en una institución pública. La carrera dura 3 años de los cuales lleva estudiando 7 meses. En la actualidad  trabaja ayudando en la estética de su mama donde realiza diferentes trabajos relacionados con la belleza.Grisell siente vocación por su carrera  y desea culminarla con éxito, para el desarrollo de su carrera encontró varias dificultades una de ellas es el costo elevado de los materiales que utiliza. El préstamo solicitado lo utilizara para la compra de equipos de cosmética y dermatología gracias a esta ayuda podrá culminar su carrera, en el futuro quiere tener su propio spa.Grisell agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por este gran apoyo.
texts.en: Grisell is 18 years old. She is single and is currently a student of Dermatologic Cosmetology in a public institution. The course of study lasts 3 years, and she has been studying for 7 months. She currently works helping out in her mother’s beauty salon, where she does different jobs related to beauty. Grisell feels a vocation for her studies and wants to complete them successfully. In carrying out her studies, she has come across several challenges. One of them is the high cost of the materials she uses. She will use the requested loan to buy cosmetic and dermatological equipment. With this help she will be able to finish her studies. In the future, she wants to have her own spa. Grisell thanks the Kiva lenders for their wonderful support.

loans.use: to buy materials for her studies.

loans.name: Martina Azucena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Martina, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad,  dos  hijas  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Martina con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de sobrecamas, edredones, carteras y en ciertas ocasiones ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos,  la mayor parte de sus ventas es por pedidos que sus clientes le realizan con anticipación. Ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Lleva más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: sabanas, edredones y carteras ya que tienen varios pedidos. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 
Su sueño es tener un local.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Siempre Unidas" meets every two weeks in Jipijapa canton, which is named for a coffee sultan and is known for its extensive coffee farms that produce delicious coffee, for its food, and for its friendly residents. Martina, 52, lives here. She is married and has three grown children from the marriage. Her two daughters live with her, and her husband is a mechanic. 

Martina sells sheets, quilts, purses, and, at times, all kinds of clothing to support her household. She sells door-to-door and also from her house, where the customers she knows well come to shop. Most of her sales are from orders that customers place, and she offers her customers credit with two-week payment terms. She buys merchandise in Guayaquil every two weeks or once a month as needed. She has had the business for 10 years, and it is prospering. 

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like sheets, quilts, and purses to fill orders. She has been a member of the communal bank from the beginning and likes the help she gets from the loans. She dreams of having a shop.

loans.use: to buy sheets, quilts, and purses.

loans.name: Jorge Julian

texts.es: Jorge tiene 24 años es estudiante de Computación e Informática, este es el segundo préstamo que solicita y gracias a él podrá continuar con sus estudios. En la actualidad continúa trabajando como asistente para una empresa de alimentos. Jorge lleva estudiando 2 años le falta solo uno para terminar su carrera y dedicarse de lleno a su profesión. El préstamo solicitado lo utilizara para el pago de sus pensiones para este nuevo ciclo que inicia, lo que más desea en el futuro es tener  su propia empresa dedicada a la informática y redes. Jorge  está agradecido a los inversionistas de KIVA por este nuevo préstamo.
texts.en: Jorge is 24 years old. He is a student in Computation and Information Systems. This is the second loan he has requested, and thanks to it he will be able to continue with his studies. He currently continues to work as an assistant for a food business. Jorge has been studying for 2 years and he only needs one more to finish his major so he can dedicate himself full time to his profession. He will use the requested loan to pay his tuition for the new cycle he is beginning. What he most hopes for in the future is to have his own business that works in information systems and networks. Jorge is grateful to the Kiva lenders for his new loan.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El señor Jorge, junto a su familia aspira siempre con poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ya que para el es mucha importancia la mejora de su casa con este credito que esta solicitando Jorge compra materiales de construccion ya que necesita ampliar un poco mas su vivienda para poder tener mayor espacio, los materiales a utilizar son Cemento, arena, bloques. el tiene u pequeño taller de reparacion de Electrodomestico y su esposa le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que labora para el hospital de su municipicio. Agradece le apoyo que kiva y afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en:
Jorge and his family always aspire to improve their living conditions and the improvement of his house is an example of that.  The loan that Jorge is asking for is for the purchasing of construction materials.  He needs to widen his home a little so that he can have more space. 

The materials that he is going to use are cement, sand, and blocks. He has a small electric household appliance repair shop and his wife helps him with the household expenses with her job since she works at the town hospital. He is grateful for the support provided by Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Estilitas

texts.en:
Estilitas is a widow, with three children. She is 75 years old and lives in Colupan, Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Estilitas sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for a year. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy new goods to sell to customers, including assorted breads, coffees, milk, sugar, energy drinks, cocoa, biscuits, crackers ,oats, flakes, etc.

Estilitas has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, she hopes to save for some future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy new goods to sell, including assorted breads, coffees, milk, sugar, energy drinks, cocoa, biscuits, crackers, oats, flakes, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  19, 16 y 8  años de edad,  todos aun  viven con ella y estudia en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Carmen con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de la marca Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, además sus hijas le ayudan a vender en sus centros de estudios,  ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días,  lleva más de 10  años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes ya que son muy buenos y a precios cómodos. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 12 años  y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Siempre Unidas" meets every two weeks in Jipijapa canton, which is named for a coffee sultan and is know for its extensive coffee farms, for its food, and for its friendly residents. Carmen, 37, lives here. She is married and has three children, ages 19, 16, and 8, with her husband. Her children still live with her and are students in college, high school, and elementary school. Her husband is a merchant. 

Carmen sells Belcorp brand catalog merchandise (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories) to earn income. She works every day, usually in the morning because it is easier to make her rounds at this time. Her daughters also help by selling merchandise at their schools. She offers weekly credit terms. She has run her business for 10 years, and it is prospering and she has many clients. She mostly sells cosmetics and perfume because the products are good and the prices are reasonable.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams. She has been a communal bank member for 12 years, and she likes that she started her business with one of the loans. Her dream is to see her children graduate and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams.

loans.name: Gladys Nancy

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Gladiz, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos. Su esposo es maestro.
Doña Gladys es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder sentirse independiente se dedica a la venta de joyas, ella vende todo tipo de joyas como cadenas, aretes, esclavas, anillos y todos en oro de la mejor calidad. Su forma de venta es informal ella recorre ofreciendo estos productos o si no vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 9  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, las joyas se las envían de Chordeleg lugar donde realizan las mejores joyas en el Ecuador, aunque en ocasiones viaja hasta este lugar a comprar.
Este crédito es para comprar joyas de todo tipo. Lleva 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 
Su sueño es tener una joyería.
texts.en:
The Siempre Unidas [Always United] Communal Bank meets twice a month in the Jipijapa Canton, which is called the Sultan of Coffee for the canton's extensive coffee crops and their unmatched flavor, the local cuisine, and the warmth of Jipijapa's people. This is where Doña Gladiz, aged 53, lives. She is married to the father of her three children, a teacher. 

Doña Gladiz is a housewife who works selling jewelry in order to earn her own income and gain a sense of independence. Doña Gladiz sells all types of jewelry, such as chains, earrings, bracelets, rings, all made of the highest-quality gold. She sells the jewelry outside the home, but also hosts her most familiar customers at her home. Doña Gladiz's customers can buy on credit and she collects payments every eight days. She has over nine years experience selling jewelry and the business is doing well. Doña Gladiz's jewelry is delivered from Chordeleg, where artisans make the best jewelry in Ecuador, and where she sometimes goes to buy merchandise directly. 

This loan is for the purchase of all types of jewelry. Doña Gladiz has been with the Communal Bank for two years and likes that payments are easy to make. Her ambition is to one day own a jewelry shop.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 36 years old and married, with three children who are in school.  Dinah works very hard to provide for them.

Dinah runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Dinah has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y uno de 15 años el cual  estudian en colegio, todos sus hijos aun vive con ella. Su esposo no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Narcisa es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto salir adelante ya que  su esposo no puede trabajar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo, artículos para el hogar por cartillas y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos días ya que ella sale a recorrer y también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que según dice son muy buenos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva 14 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The “Siempre Unidas” communal bank meets every fifteen days in the cantón of Jipijapa, a cantón known by the name of the sultan of coffee because of the extensive plantations of coffee, which has incomparable flavor, and for its food and the warmth of its people.

This is where Naricisa lives. She is 56 years old and is married. From that marriage she has four children, three who are of age and one who is 15 years old and is studying in high school. All of her children live with her. Her husband doesn’t work because of health-related reasons. 

Narcisa is a homemaker who, in order to obtain her own money and get ahead since her husband can’t work, works in commerce. She sells clothing via catalogues, household items, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works every day since she goes out to sell and also sells from her house, where she has some vitrines. She sells her products on credit and charges every eight days. She has been working in this activity for 15 years and it is going very well for her. What she sells most are perfumes and cosmetics, since they are very good. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and clothing. She has been in the communal bank for 14 years and she likes it because they grant her the loans. 

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.

Eliza has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell.

Eliza has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Eliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 42 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emma has been raising pigs for two years.  She also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Claire

texts.fr: Claire est une femme mariée de 39ans à un soudeur. Elle a un enfant de 6ans scolarisé. Elle est achète et revend des kits de transferts, des cartes de recharge et des kits des kits de connexion au marché à toutes personnes. Elle sollicite un second prêt auprès de WAGES pour l’achat de kit de transfert, de cartes de recharges et des kits de connexion pour la revente. Elle exerce son activité depuis 2005. Elle espère devenir grossiste et avoir une bonne famille.
texts.en: Claire is a 39-year-old woman married to a welder. She has a 6-year-old child who attends school. Claire is in the business of purchasing and reselling telephone transfer kits, recharge cards, and connection kits at a local market to all types of customers. She is requesting a second loan from WAGES in order to purchase transfer kits, recharge cards, and connection kits for resale. She has been in business since 2005. She hopes one day to become a wholesaler and to have a healthy family.

loans.use: to buy recharge cards and connection kits

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es de la ciudad de Pilar, es el estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial. Es una persona que se esfuerza mucho por poder crecer y el día de mañana ser un gran profesional.
Su meta es lograr a ser un profesional calificado para un buen desempeño. Vive con sus padres, tiene 2 hermanos. Comenta además que quiere ayudar a su familia y poder aportar en la casa.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de universidad. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Luis is from the city of Pilar and is a student of industrial engineering. He is a person who works hard to grow and in the future he will be a great professional. 
His goal is to be a qualified professional and perform well. He lives with his parents and has two siblings. He says he wants to help his family and to contribute in the household. 
He is applying for this loan in order to invest in the payment of his fees and to cover college expenses. He is thankful for the opportunity he is getting to keep growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees and cover college expenses.

loans.name: Elsa Mercedes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  22, 21 y 8  años de edad,  la mayor estudia en universidad y el menor en escuela los dos aun  viven con ella. Su esposo tiene un taller de soldadura y pintura de carros.
Doña Elsa con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos como ropa, zapatos y productos de Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, ella trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace dos años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Lleva más de 4 años en  el Banco Comunal  y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Siempre Unidas” communal bank meets every fifteen days in the cantón of Jipijapa, a cantón known by the name of the sultan of coffee because of the extensive plantations of coffee, which has an incomparable flavor, and for its food and the warmth of its people.

This is where Elsa lives. She is 39 years old. She is married and from this relationship she has three children who are 22, 21, and 18 years old. The oldest is studying at university and the youngest is in school. Both of them live with her. Her husband has a shop where he solders and paints cars. 

Elsa, with the goal of having her own income, works selling products from catalogs, such as clothing, shoes, and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories). She sells door to door and by orders. She works every day, especially in the morning hours since this is when it’s easier for her to go out and make her sales. She sells on credit and charges each week. She loves sales and she has been doing this for two years, during which time things have gone very well for her because she has a lot of customers. What she sells the most are cosmetics and perfumes. 

She will use this loan to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and lotions. She has been in the communal bank for 4 year and she likes it because it was with those loans that she started her business. 

Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and lotions.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.  She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 35 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Lolita has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aïdekon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AÏDEKON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée Huguette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 29 ans. Huguette a très peu fréquenté l’école. Huguette est mariée à un certain Antoine. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et cinq à leur charge. Huguette vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par Huguette et son mari. Pour ce faire, Huguette vend du maïs et du gari (farine fait à base de manioc) dans sa région depuis quatre ans. Huguette s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de développer son activité, Huguette s’associe aux autres membres du groupe AÏDEKON pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Aïdekon group is made up of three people who live in the same village. The representative of the group, named Huguette (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) is 29 years old. She attended very little schooling. Huguette is married to Antoine, and the couple has six children, some of whom attend school and five of whom are still in their care.

Huguette lives with her husband and children, and together they provide for the support of the household. In order to accomplish this, Huguette has sold corn and "gari" (a flour made from cassava) in her region for the last 4 years. She stocks up in a market in Benin. In order to expand her business Huguette and the other members of the Aïdekon group are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase corn and gari (a flour made from cassava)

loans.name: Tovinonvigbe Group

texts.fr: TOVINONVIGBE est un groupe composé de huit personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée Antoinette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 48 ans. Antoinette n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Antoinette est mariée à un cultivateur nommé Roger. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Antoinette vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. C'est pour cette raison que Antoinette vend des boissons alcoolisés communément appelé "Sodabi" et de la farine de manioc "gari" dans sa région depuis cinq ans. Antoinette s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Antoinette s’associe aux autres membres du groupe TOVINONVIGBE pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Tovinonvigbe is a group made up of 8 people who live in the same village. The representative of the group, named Antoinette (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) is 48 years old. Antoinette did not attend school. She is married to a farmer named Roger. The couple has three children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care.

Antoinette lives with her husband and their children. Together, the couple is responsible for the household expenses. It is for this reason that Antoinette has been selling the alcoholic beverages locally called "Sodabi" as well as "gari" cassava flour in her region for the last five years. She stocks up in a market in Benin. In order to expand her business, Antoinette and the other members of the Tovinonvigbe group are partnering to request a third loan from ALIDé. Their previous loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase "Sodabi" alcoholic beverages and "gari" cassava flour

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a 51-year-old woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with two grown children.  Her husband worked as a driver to support their family. She engages in the hog-raising business. She raises and sells pigs to earn a living, to help augment the income of their household. Her business started three years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and pig feed.

In the future, Jesusa hopes to expand her hog-raising business and increase business profitability for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 55 años vive al lado de su esposa, la cual es su fuerza y sobre todo quien le da ánimo para seguir y salir adelante, la vivienda de Luis se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona; la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo  se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Luis es un hombre muy trabajador, día a día traba en su parcela, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y sobre todo le gusta mucho su trabajo por ello el cree que le va bien, porque lo trabaja de buena manera y muchos ánimos.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar semillas, abono, fertilizantes, así como también cubrir los gastos de riego y limpieza de la parcela, de esta manera el podrá sembrar su cultivo y podrá seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una hacienda”.
texts.en:
Luis, age 55, lives with his wife.  She is his strength, and, above all, she is the one who motivates him to get ahead.  Luis’s house is in the city of Ica in the Parcona district.  The city is known for being very warm and welcoming.

He works with agriculture and livestock.  Luis is a very hard-working man.  He works on his plot of land day to day.  He works around nine hours a day.  Above all, he really likes his work.  He believes that it is going well for him because he works well and with a lot of energy.

Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizers.  He will also cover the expenses for watering and clearing the weeds from the land.  This way he will be able to plant his crop.  He will be able to continue struggling each day in order to be able to make his biggest dream come true.  He dream is to have a farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fresh fish to resell

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 60 years old, single, and is working hard to earn a living.

Magdalena has a buy-and-sell spice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell like onion, garlic, dried beans, etc.

Magdalena has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell like onion, garlic, dried beans, etc.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 30 years old and has four children. She is married and her four children are in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Analyn has been buying and selling livestock for eleven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is 31 years old and has three children. She is married and her three children are in school.

Rosenie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Rosenie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosenie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase general food products

loans.name: Ayidekon De Ze Togoudo Group

texts.fr: AYIDEKON DE ZE TOGOUDO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée Valentine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 33 ans. Valentine  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Valentine est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Benoît. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Valentine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par Valentine et son mari. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Valentine vend du gari (farine de manioc) et des poulets dans sa région depuis trois ans. Valentine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Valentine s’associe aux autres membres du groupe AYIDEKON DE ZE TOGOUDO pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Ayidekon De Ze Togoudo is a group made up of three people who live in the same village. The representative of the group, named Valentine (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) is 33 years old. Valentine did not attend school. She is married to a farmer named Benoît. The couple has two children, one of whom attends school, and both of whom are in their care. Valentine lives with her husband and their children, and together they provide for the support of the household.

In order to provide for the family's needs, Valentine has been selling gari (cassava flour) and chickens in her region for three years. She stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to improve her business, Valentine partnered with the other members of Ayidekon De Ze Togoudo to request a second loan from ALIDé. Their previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase gari (cassava flour) and chickens

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ludy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling feeds. Ludy is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Ludy has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Manilen

texts.en:
Manilen is 22 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Manilen is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Manilen has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Manilen would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kanouya ( L’Amour) Group

texts.fr:
Kanouya est un regroupement de femmes de Baramba qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, sont mariées avec en moyenne 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, la vente des graines d’arachide, de haricot, des condiments, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt de groupe. 
Kadia  est un membre du groupe Kanouya est la 2 eme assise de la droite vers la gauche.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs d’arachide et toutes sortes de condiments. Elle se procure de ces condiments à Baramba et revend  en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kanouya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Kadia compte réaliser  55 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Kanouya is a group of women from Baramba who know each other well and who live in traditional large families with their husbands, children, and other parents. The women have an average age of 39 years, are married, and have an average of 4 children each. The women of this group are in different businesses, such as the sale of peanuts, beans, spices, etc.

In order to increase their businesses, the members of the group decided to partner with the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Kadia is a member of the Kanouya group and is the second pictured sitting from right to left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to purchase bags of peanuts and all kinds of spices. She purchases these spices in Baramba and resells them at retail for cash from her home and in the market to a diverse customer base. While the other members of the Kanouya group hope to earn an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA each during the course of the loan cycle, Kadia hopes to earn 55,000 francs CFA. In addition to repaying the loan, the women will use a portion of their earnings to care for their personal expenses and to increase their business funds.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Tagne (Aller De L’Avant) Group

texts.fr:
Tagne est un regroupement de femmes de Baramba qui se connaissent bien et  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, sont mariées et avec en moyenne 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers, de  la restauration etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt de groupe. 
Diarra  est un membre du groupe Tagne, debout avec une louche qui sert à enlever ses grillades de l’huile.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac de haricot et de l’huile. Elle se procure  du sac de haricot au marché. Elle vend son beignet bien cuit au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Tagne comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Diarra  compte réaliser  60 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Tagne is a group of women from Baramba who know each other well and who live in traditional larger families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They have an average age of 30 years, are married, and have an average of 4 children each. The women of the group are in the business of selling various items, catering, etc.

In order to increase their businesses, the women decided to partner with the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan. Diarra is a member of the Tagne group, pictured standing with a ladle that is used to remove grilled items from the oil. She plans on using her loan to purchase a bag of beans and oil. She purchases the beans at the market, and resells her cooked pastries for cash from her home and at the market to a diverse customer base. 

While the other members of the Tagne group hope to earn an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA each at the end of the loan cycle, Diarra hopes to earn 60,000 francs CFA. In addition to repayment of the loan, the women will use a portion of their earnings to care for their personal expenses and to increase their business funds.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds and oil for preparing pastries

loans.name: Jebeth

texts.en:
Jebeth is a 23-year-old single woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She has a vegetable business. She sells eggplant, squash, beans, tomatoes, green onions, and other green leafy vegetables to help augment the income of her household. 

Jebeth started her business 1 year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy dried fish, oil, and eggs to maintain the inventory of the store. In the future, Jebeth hopes to expand her vegetable business and increase profitability to improve her status of living.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, oil, and eggs.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 59 years old, married, and has ten children.

Luzviminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like rice, snack foods, noodles, and other groceries.

Luzviminda has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from dressmaking.

Luzviminda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like rice, snack foods, noodles, and other groceries

loans.name: Wassa( La Satisfaction) Group

texts.fr:
