Wassa est un regroupement de femmes de Baramba qui se connaissent bien car elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, vente de riz, de graines d’arachide, d’haricot et des paniers, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt de groupe. 
Mife  est un membre du groupe Wassa , assise  au milieu.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs d’haricot et des paniers pour la vente. Elle se procure de ces sacs d’haricot au marché et quant aux paniers, confectionnés par son mari, elle les achète sur place. Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Wassa comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Mife compte réaliser  60 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses de la famille et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Wassa is a group of women from Baramba who know each other well and live in traditional large families with their husbands, children, and other parents. The women have an average age of 40 years, are married, and have at least 5 children each. The women of this group are in business selling various items, such as rice, peanuts, beans, baskets, etc. In order to expand their businesses, the members decided to partner with the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Mife is a member of the Wassa group, pictured seated in the middle of the photo. She plans to use her loan to purchase bags of beans and baskets for resale. She purchases the beans at the market and the baskets, which are made by her husband, she purchases locally. She sells these items at retail for cash from her home and in the market to a diverse customer base. 

While the other members of the Wassa group hope to earn an average profit of 55,000 francs CFA at the end of the loan cycle, Mife hopes to earn 60,000 francs CFA. In addition to repaying the loan, the women will use a portion of the earnings to care for their family's expenses and to increase their business funds.

loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Lassina

texts.fr:
Né vers 1966, marié et père de 5 enfants, Lassina est un Pharmacien qui vit dans la ville de Koutiala.  
Dans le souci de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients de plus en plus nombreux, il décide de faire recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui, il est à son 3ème prêt,  qui sera utilisé pour l’achat des produits pharmaceutiques auprès des laboratoires de distribution de produits pharmaceutiques de Bamako. Il effectue sa vente en détail au comptant, à une clientèle mixte.
LASSINA envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born in 1966, married and the father of 5 children, Lassina is a pharmacist who lives in the city of Koutiala. In order to meet his growing customers' needs, he decided to partner with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his third loan. He will use this loan to purchase pharmaceutical products from laboratories for distribution in Bamako. He makes his sales at retail for cash, to a customer base of both men and women. Lassina hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA which he will use to repay the loan, take care of his family's expenses, and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase pharmaceutical items

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en: Patrocinia, is 33 years old, married, has four children, and lives in Aurora, Misamis Occidental along with her family. She helps her husband to operate their own farmland, planting and harvesting bananas and corn for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business three years. She joined GDMPC in 2009, and her previous loan that she used for their farm was successfully repaid. Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase a new variety of  corn seeds and organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of corn seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mariacil

texts.en:
Mariacil works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Mariacil requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of clothing to sell. Mariacil has been in this business for 5 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 44 years old, married, and has six children; five of her children are in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Merlinda has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Leonisa requested a 12,000  PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, and other products. Leonisa has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Leonisa would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, and other products.

loans.name: Hatedia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Hatedia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Hatedia is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Hatedia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years. Jocelyn earns additional income from raising pigs and chickens.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family, and so her children can finish their studies in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 46 years old,married, and has five children.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell like soap, sugar, milk, coffee, spices, etc.

Arlene has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Arlene aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell like soap, sugar, milk, coffee, spices, etc.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia, a 60-year-old resident of Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur provides for her children's needs from the little amount she earns from her piggery for more than three years. She joined GDMPC in 2012 and her previous loan that she used to buy feed was successfully repaid. Aside from her piggery, she also has a garden of vegetables which she sells in the market to make an extra income for the family. Recently, she has just started cultivating a new plot of vegetables. For this, she borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy an organic fertilizer and assorted varieties of vegetable seeds. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy an organic fertilizer and assorted varieties of vegetable seeds

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a 56-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married with 7 children. The youngest child is 19 years old. Her husband worked as a company guard to support their family. 

She has a pig fattening business. She raises and sells pigs to help augment the income of her household. She started her business less than a year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and pig feed so that the pigs can grow faster and be sold on time. 

In the future, Prima hopes to expand her pig fattening business and increase profitability to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Estrella Soledad

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Estrella, tiene 55 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, todos aun viven en su casa a pesar de que ya están comprometidos. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
Doña Estrella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando quieren alguna prenda. Trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil o a Manta cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene más de 6  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque el grupo es unido y confiable. 
Su sueño es tener salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The December 24th communal bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts that are recognized at both a national and international level.  It is the home of the famous panama straw hat.

This is where Señora Estrella lives.  She is 55 years old, married, and has three older children from this relationship.  They all still live in her home although they are already engaged.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

With the intention of earning something for her account and using this to get ahead at home, Doña Estrella makes a living selling all kinds of clothing.  She sells door to door and also out of her home, where her customers come when they want a garment.  She works every day without a set schedule, sells to her customers via credit, and collects every 15 days.  To buy her merchandise she goes to Guayaquil or Manta every 15 days to a month, according to her need.  She has spent more than 6 years making a living through this work and it is going well.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because the group is close and trustworthy.  Her dream is to have health for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries for her general store business.

Marina has been in this business for 5 years. Marina earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Josephine is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional inventory like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, cream, etc,. for her general store business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, cream, etc.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish selling business.

Nelly has been in this business for 7 years. Nelly earns additional income from pig fattening.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop.  Melanie is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, butter, and other items for her food vending business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, butter, and other items.

loans.name: Mercedes Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 47 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tuvo seis hijos pero dos fallecieron, de los 4 que tiene tres son  mayores de edad, el menor tiene 12 años y estudia en escuela, todos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es obrero.
Doña Mercedes para salir adelante ya que a su esposo no le alcanza con lo que gana, desde hace dos años atrás surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa la cual le permite ganarse algo por el bienestar de su familia y suyo, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  agua en bidón sodas y golosinas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda cuando el llega de su trabajo o cuando está desocupado, empezó su negocio con muy poco de dinero que tenia y con la ayuda de uno de los créditos y así con los que ha recibido la fue aumentando y surtiendo poco a poco. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda ya que va a comprar víveres, frutas y legumbres. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 
Sus sueños seguir mejorando y tener un mejor local.
texts.en:
The "24 de Diciembre"  communal bank meets every fortnight in the Canton of Montecristi. This city is known for it's rich precolonial culture and it's handicrafts which are recognized at a national and international level. This is the home of the famous Panama hat. 

Mercedes lives here. She is 47 years old, married and from this union has six children. Two of them died and of the other four, three are still minors. The youngest, 12, studies in school. They all live at home. Her husband is a laborer. 

Two years ago, seeing that her husband's earnings couldn't cover all their expenses, Mercedes started  to stock a small store with food in order to get ahead. This allows her to make something for her well-being and that of her family. The store is located in their house.  She sells all sorts of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, vegetables, fruits, water in 19 liter bottles and sweets. She works every day from 6 am until 8 pm, sometimes even later. Her husband helps her when he gets home from work and when he is unemployed. She started the business with the little money she had and with the help of the loans she has received, the business has grown and  become better stocked little by little. 

Mercedes will use this loan to stock her store more as she will buy food, fruits and vegetables. Mercedes has been a member of the communal bank since it's inception. She likes it as the loans are a great help. Her dream is to continue improving and to have a better store.

loans.use: to buy provisions, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 45 years old and married with four children. Marlyn works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soap, eggs, noodles, cream, soft drinks, and other products. Marlyn has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years, and also earns an income from farming rice. Marlyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soap, eggs, noodles, cream, soft drinks, and other products.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 67 years old and widowed with six children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase inventory to sell like soap, cream, soft drinks, eggs, spices, etc.

Editha has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Editha aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell like soap, cream, soft drinks, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old, widowed, and has five children. Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Evelyn has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from raising pigs. Evelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc., for her general store business.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years. Lolita earns additional income from farming rice.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is a 60-year-old woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married and has 4 grown children. Her husband worked as driver to support their family. 

She has a food vending business. She sells homemade meals like fish soup, stewed vegetables, fried chicken, and pancit bihon (very thin rice noodles fried with soy sauce, citrus, and some variation of sliced meat and chopped vegetables) to help augment the income of her household. She started her business 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy various supplies such as seasoning, fish, meat, rice, and soft drinks.

In the future, Victoriana hopes to expand her food vending business and increase profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as seasoning, fish, meat, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc., for her general store business.

Mary Joy has been in this business for 4 years. Mary Joy earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like colored chalk, tape measures, linens, etc., for her tailoring business.

Consolacion has been in this business for 3 years. Consolacion earns additional income from pig fattening.

Consolacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like colored chalk, tape measures, linens, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 34 years old and married. with four children; two of her children are in school. Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years.  She sells a variety of items, such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comités, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder trabajar juntas y poder mejorar sus vidas y su economía.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucy, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con gran esfuerzo ha podido superarse y ayudar a su familia por medio de ese trabajo. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y mejorando para ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, camisas, shorts, pantalones y demás, con lo que podrá seguir invirtiendo en su emprendimiento y mejorando su economía.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Guapa is in its second cycle of committees.  They are doing a survey on the elimination of poverty to be able to work together and to be able to improve their lives and finances.

One of the member is Ms. Lucy, who sells a variety of clothing.  She is a very hardworking woman who with a lot of sacrifice has been able to advance ahead and help her family through this work.  Her goal is to be able to continue expanding and improving to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing T-shirts, shirts, shorts, pants and so forth.  With this she can continue investing in her business venture and improving her finances.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shirts, shorts, pants, and so forth.

loans.name: Percys

texts.en:
Percys is married, with one child. She is 31 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Philippines.

Percys is a farmer who grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer for her corn and to acquire additional housing materials, such as cement, common nails, plywood, etc.

Percys has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Percys hopes to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn and to acquire housing materials such as cement, common nails, and plywood.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 51 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Amparo is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Amparo requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to raise.

Amparo has been raising livestock for twenty years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amparo would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 35 years old, widowed, and has six children. Four of her children are in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As the widowed mother of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from a general store. Teresita is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Teresita has sustained her business activities through no fewer than 17 past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her pottery.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 5 years. Erlinda earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 63 years old and a widow, with six children. She's been into buying and selling rice and corn for almost 15 years.  In this business she's earning a net income of PHP 3,500 weekly. 

Due to a lack of capital she has request a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase more rice and corn to sell. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can able to earn more profits in her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice and corn to sell

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 52 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun  viven en su casa. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.
Doña Ana es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante con el fruto de su trabajo, ella realiza trabajos de limpieza faciales y también vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), ella realiza sus trabajos ya sea en su casa o a domicilio y al mismo tiempo va ofreciendo sus productos, lleva más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le ayuda a sacar adelante su hogar.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar productos para las limpiezas faciales y productos  Yanbal. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan para salir adelante. 
Su sueño es tener un spa.
texts.en:
The "24 de diciembre" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, an area known for its rich, pre-colonial culture, and its artisan products that are known at both a national and international level.  It is from here that the famous straw hat originates.

It is here that Ana lives.  She is 52 years old, married and has two children, now adults.  One of her children still lives at home.  Ana's husband is a security guard.

Ana is a feisty woman who likes to make use of her time and skills in order to get ahead through her work.  Ana works giving facial treatments, and also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, make-up, perfumes, and women's accessories).  She works from her own home or does home visits for the facial treatments, and offers her customers Yanbal products.  Ana has been doing this work for seven years and it allows her to help her household to prosper.

Ana will use this loan to buy products for facial masks, and Yanbal products.  Ana has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it as the loans have helped her to get ahead.

Ana's dream is to have a spa.

loans.use: to buy products for facial masks, and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Sherry Ann

texts.en: Sherry Ann, 24, is borrowing 5,000 PHP as additional working capital for her retailing business. She will use it to purchase face powder, lipsticks, shoes, slippers and eyeliners. These goods would possibly create better earnings. She hopes that her requested amount will be provided. She is aspiring for a better way of living for her family, so she really gives her best to earn a good income for them.

loans.use: to purchase face powder, lipsticks, shoes, slippers, and eyeliners

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 33 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Geraldine is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Geraldine has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from selling bananas.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
